comment.body:
Cannot reproduce.
AdGuard for Android says https://abp.oisd.nl/ is too huge to register as a DNS filter.

If you can still reproduce it, please contact filters@adguard.com

<details><summary>Korean - 한국어</summary>
재구현할 수 없습니다.
AdGuard for Android가 https://abp.oisd.nl/를 DNS 필터로 등록하기 너무 크다고 합니다.

만약 여전히 구현하실 수 있으시면, filters@adguard.com으로 연락주세요.

</details>

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://trello.com/b/UxSwOSpw/rezepte](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftrello.com%2Fb%2FUxSwOSpw%2Frezepte) ### Comment Username: @Scolaro > Screenshot 1 (AdGuard on): I press "Attachment", choose the image I want to upload to the card and get the error message in the lower left corner. > Screenshot 2 (AdGuard off): I press "Attachment", choose the image I want to upload to the card and get the success message. The image appears in the card. > > Every once in a while an image goes through when AdGuard is on (because I forget to turn it off), but it's mostly the first one, then nothing else goes through until I turn AdGuard off. > Oftentimes I also get an error (from Trello on their website) that I am not connected to the server. Everything (creating cards, changing text etc) continues to work except for the image upload, and once AdGuard is off there are no more server error messages on the Trello site either. > Note that all my Trello pages are affected by this issue, not just the "Rezepte" one from the screenshots. ### Screenshots

comment.body: Instead of removing AdGuard Tracking Protection from the filters entirely (i.e., deleting it), it should have been disabled and moved down to Custom rules. This is the way such things have been done in the past. Let users determine if they still want to run it, don't decide for them. That isn't user friendly.

comment.body:
> krystian3w: It will be moved on update all cache...

Only if the list was already enabled/ticked/selected before updating all cache, otherwise, if it was unticked, it will be deleted then, which most likely (the latter) was the case for BlohoJo, I guess such logic: "moved if ticked, removed if unticked", is by intentional design: "why keeping something you weren't using anyway", unless rare cases when you temporarily have disabled the list and were unlucky when you realised it's gone next time you wanted to enable it.
